subject: Re: An incident that may be a concern
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Hey, I'd look at this (if true) as something positive and not 
something to fear.  A white cloud to me sounds like "light" and just 
may be a good spirit/entity or whoever, in the home. How do we know 
that this was a negative spirit/ghost trying to bring others through 
an electronic device and into a home for mischief???  ;)

I personally do not subscribe to the whole portal thing.  If so, then 
my house would be filled with ghosts after all my watching of 
innumerable paranormal TV shows!  I think my TV would make a much 
better portal than my radios...  :)

LC
http://www.AngelsGhosts.com


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "bhali333" 
<paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
>
> for all researchers,
> 
> THIS IS NOT FOR THE REASON OF PUSHING A PANIC BUTTON OR A MATTER OF 
> GIVING IN TO FEAR. 
> 
> It is simply an incident that I feel researchers should be aware of 
> as a possibility. Given in my opinion the boxes do open a portal 
due 
> to the connection necessary for real time two way communication, 
and 
> the wide spread belief that entities can and do manipulate physical 
> objects when in the presence of them.
> 
> I have just been made aware of a situation that has happened to a 
> fairly new researcher whom I believe to be honest and forthcoming.
> 
> the incident involved the aftermath of a regular RS box session. 
The 
> researcher had finished his session with the practice of asking 
that 
> any entities that may have traveled through the box, return and 
asked 
> for conformation, then proceeded to end the session and turn the 
box 
> off. he was assured that he turned the box off by going back to the 
> recording after the incident and validating verbally that he did in 
> fact turn off the box.
> 
> He left the room for a few moments , when he returned he allegedly  
> witnessed a white cloud move across the room and noticed that his 
RS 
> box was turned on and running.
> 
> This is actually the first instance I have encountered where the 
> possibility of an entity that may have
> 
> purposely stayed behind to turn the box back on and let other 
> entities through. matter of fact
> 
> that concept has not occurred to me before. but now sounds very 
> possible.
> 
> This may even happen at times we are never aware of and they 
actually 
> turn the box on and when 
> whatever comes through is through they turn it off again and we are 
> none the wiser.
> 
> I will definitely address this in my sessions, what I suggest is 
> until we come to a mutual agreement among researchers
> on this occurrence, I think it best that when we end a session we 
> remove at least one battery from the box to prevent it being turned
> back on.
> 
> 
> 
> Bruce
>
